titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Volga (Saratov, Russia) : Editorial Files, 1966 - 2000
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2003 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: Volga was a literary magazine published in Saratov, Russia, between the late 1960's and 2000. While it survived under the Soviet era and into the post-Communist Russian era, it was nevertheless shut down by Russian authorities in 2000.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on access.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Volga (Saratov, Russia) : Editorial Files. M1316. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Volga was a literary magazine published in Saratov, Russia, between the late 1960's and 2000. While it survived under the Soviet era and into the post-Communist Russian era, it was nevertheless shut down by Russian authorities in 2000.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: The collection includes correspondence between the editors and the authors, galleys, manuscripts, author information cards, photographs, and official registration documents for the operation of the journal filed with first the Soviet and then subsequently the Russian government.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Russian literature--20th century--History and criticism.
